articles.author: Sy Mukherjee
articles.title: The coronavirus testing conundrum
articles.description: Happy Wednesday, readers. I promised you a major coronavirus dispatch yesterday. Well, it went up last night. In the course of writing this story on the mess that is the coronavirus testing procedure (and what such tests might cost a patient), I reached out t…

articles.author: Chris Morris
articles.title: Coronavirus is mutating: Chinese scientists find second strain
articles.description: There are at least two forms of the COVID-19 coronavirus, say researchers.

articles.author: Claire Zillman, reporter
articles.title: Amazon’s U.S. workforce has its first confirmed case of coronavirus
articles.description: The employee is based in Seattle, where there's a concentration of COVID-19 cases.

articles.author: reymashayekhi
articles.title: The Fed tries to calm heads—but markets roil instead
articles.description: After reversing some of last week’s coronavirus-induced declines on Monday, the global markets were much more tepid on Tuesday—while the mood in New York was downright bearish.

articles.author: Chris Morris
articles.title: When will PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X debut? With coronavirus, it’s anyone’s guess
articles.description: Supply chain uncertainty could mean delays or shortages for Sony and Microsoft.

articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: ‘Collective psychosis:’ As coronavirus fears grow, the world travel industry stares into the abyss
articles.description: At stake is the $1.7 trillion in revenue that international tourism generated in 2018, according to the UN World Tourism Organization.

articles.author: Grady McGregor
articles.title: China scoffed at being subject to early coronavirus travel restrictions. Now it’s enacting its own
articles.description: The move indicates the virus's global spread and China's emergence as a safe haven.

articles.author: eamonbarrett
articles.title: Will the coronavirus cancel or postpone the 2020 Olympics? Host city Tokyo sends mixed messages
articles.description: Tokyo had been resolute in carrying on, but now cracks are appearing in that narrative

articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: Once coronavirus fades, global businesses are set to face new danger: a wave of lawsuits
articles.description: Businesses are scrambling to see if their insurance policies cover disruptions caused by the virus. Governments are reviewing their quarantine powers.

articles.author: radmarya
articles.title: James Bond sequel ‘No Time to Die’ delayed until November due to coronavirus
articles.description: “No Time To Die” will now hit theaters in the U.K. on Nov. 12 and worldwide on Nov. 25.

articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: As coronavirus savages world’s mega-fortunes, U.S. surges ahead as home to the fabulously rich
articles.description: During last week’s coronavirus-fueled rout of equity markets, the combined fortunes of the world’s 500 richest people dropped $444 billion over five tumultuous trading days.

articles.author: Jaclyn Gallucci
articles.title: Deal reached on bipartisan $8.3B bill to battle coronavirus
articles.description: Capitol Hill negotiators have reached agreement on an $8.3 billion measure to battle the coronavirus outbreak that's spreading and threatening a major shock to the economy and disruptions to everyday life in the U.S.
